briefTitle: An Extension Study of V203-AD Study to Evaluate the Safety, Tolerability, Immunogenicity, and Efficacy of UB-311
officialTitle: An Extension Study of a Phase IIa Study in Patients With Mild Alzheimer's Disease to Evaluate the Safety, Tolerability, Immunogenicity, and Efficacy of UBITh® AD Immunotherapeutic Vaccine (UB-311)

eligibilityCriteria.criteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Patients who participated in V203-AD trial without major safety concerns;
* Stable doses of permitted medications for 3 months before screening;
* With a caregiver;
* Other inclusion criteria apply

Exclusion Criteria:

* Clinically significant neurological disease other than Alzheimer's disease
* Major psychiatric disorder
* Severe systemic disease
* Serious adverse reactions to any vaccine
* Other exclusion criteria apply

primary.measure: The Incidence of Adverse Event (AE)/Serious Adverse Event (SAE) [Safety and Tolerability]).
primary.description: Summary of Treatment Emergent Adverse Events (TEAEs), based on reported adverse events and other safety information including local tolerability at injection site, MRI, vital signs, physical examination, 12-lead ECG and laboratory tests.
primary.timeFrame: Overall Study Duration/Early Termination, over an average study duration of 326 days

primary.measure: Change From Baseline and Through to the End of the Study in Anti-Aβ Antibody Titers [The Immunogenicity of UB-311]
primary.description: For the immunogenicity assessment of the investigational product, UB-311, the level of anti-Aβ antibodies in the serum samples will be measured by a validated enzyme immunoassay manufactured by United Biomedical, Inc. (UBI). The level of anti-Aβ antibodies is assessed at every visit throughout the study period.
primary.timeFrame: Overall Study Duration/Early Termination, over an average study duration of 326 days

other.measure: Change From Baseline and Through to the End of the Study in Alzheimer's Disease Assessment Scale-Cognitive Subscale (ADAS-Cog);
other.description: The ADAS-Cog 13 contains 13 items, with a total scoring range of 0 - 85 and higher scores indicating greater dysfunction. ADAS-Cog scores were evaluated at V1 and V8/ET. The observed values and change from baseline for ADAS-Cog scores by treatment groups in the extension study are presented
other.timeFrame: Overall Study Duration/Early Termination, over an average study duration of 326 days

other.measure: Change From Baseline and Through to the End of the Study in Mini-Mental State Exam (MMSE)
other.description: The MMSE is a 30-point questionnaire. The total score range is 0 - 30 and lower scores indicating greater impairment. MMSE scores were evaluated at V1 and V8/ET. The observed values and change from baseline for MMSE scores by treatment groups in the extension study are presented
other.timeFrame: Overall Study Duration/Early Termination, over an average study duration of 326 days

other.measure: Change From Baseline and Through to the End of the Study in Clinical Dementia Rating - Sum of Boxes (CDR-SB)
other.description: The CDR-SB includes 6 domains (0 - 3 points/domain), with a total scoring range of 0 - 18 and higher scores indicate greater impartment. CDR-SB scores were evaluated at V1 and V8/ET. The observed values and change from baseline for CDR-SB scores by treatment groups in the extension study are presented
other.timeFrame: Overall Study Duration/Early Termination, over an average study duration of 326 days
